task.title: Assembly and Baking
task.shortdesc: Instructions for assembling and baking the bread loaf.

taskbody.context:
Steps to assemble the dough into a sprial and baking directions.
Assembling the dough:

step.cmd: Make the cinnamon filling and set aside.

substep.cmd: Mix together the brown sugar, cinnamon, melted butter, salt,and vanilla extract.

step.cmd: Remove the dough from the fridge. Sprinkle some flour on a clean table or cutting board.
Using a rolling pin, roll out the dough into a rectangular shape, about 8-9 inches wide (the length does not matter).
Using a rubber spatula or spoon, spread the cinnamon sugar filling over the rectangle, leaving an inch border around each edge.
Taking one short end of the dough, start rolling the dough into a log shape. (This is much easier if the dough has been chilled).
Once the dough is rolled, use a bench scraper to cut the dough in half. Place each loaf into a greased 9x4 loaf pan.
Allow the loaves to rise for 2-3 hours, or until the loaves rise about 1 inch ovewr the lip of the pan. The time will vary depending on your climate.
Bake the loaves for 25 minutes. Place tinfoil over the loaves to prevent excess browning.
Reduce the heat to 325°F. Bake for another 15-25 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cool the loaves on a wire rack for 2 hours (if you can manage to wait that long!)
